section.p: It seems to recognise the banner.
‘Pass, friend,’ it booms, and then fades away.

You enter the ruined city along a road lined with gigantic stone heads. Each granite face sheds carved tears of stone. You trek past mounds of rubble and wild, overgrown gardens. The wind whistles a doleful dirge through the deserted streets and shattered houses.

You come to a large central square in the middle of which has been laid a wide, circular mosaic that depicts a map of the city. Most of the places marked on the map are no more, but a few have stood the test of time.

choices.choice: Visit the Vault of the Shadar
